comments.html:
For the moment isn't really delivering though.

doesn't support NX-OS, doesn't support Junos, doesn't support SONiC. I can't wait to see it outside of a few screenshots
comments.name: Andrea Florio

comments.html: Ironically this reads like an advertisement from the vendors it claims you don't need.
comments.name: Richard Olson

comments.html:
@Andrea: Dinesh claims SuzieQ is open-source and extensible, so what's stopping you from adding support for NX-OS or Junos? As for SONiC - if you plan to use SONiC in production, and don't have the capabilities to extend something like SuzieQ to fit your needs, you might want to reconsider your decision.

Talking about "screenshots" - what's stopping you from downloading the container image and going for a test ride?

@Richard: I profusely apologize for being enthusiastic about something. I promise it won't happen again in foreseeable future ;)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Yes, and that's exactly what I've been working on. 😊 More things coming up soon
comments.name: Andrea Florio
